intro: Gnaphalium cephaloideum, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are surrounded by fluffy, white bracts, giving it a soft, woolly appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
